intro: Rapanea roraimensis, commonly known as the Roraima rapanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Guiana Shield region. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
